text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Nigeria's military government threatens to review economic and social relations with European Union nations over their continued hostile stance against the country.
- Government establishes presence in oil-rich Tongeji island near neighbouring Benin with provision of portable water to the 1,800-strong community.
- Twenty-eight foreigners held hostage offshore on a vessel by Nigerian oil workers demanding higher wages.
- Six people killed in communal clash in southeastern Akwa Ibom state on Christmas eve.
